location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Henry Moore, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra], to James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green

mods.abstract: The letter discusses the deployment of ships in the Gulf to protect against the perceived threat of attack by MÄ«r Muhanna, including an expedition force to Bushire. The appointment of John Botham as writer for the expedition and the need for a 'publick table' (the provision of meals for the men of the expedition) at Bushire are also mentioned.
